WorkItem.Description:
Sorry for opening another ticket. The other one was closed and I didn't know how to reopen it, or if I even could, once I added my comment.
 
So after the last update to Rawr 4.1.03, I'm still having problems saving/loading to/from the Rawr4 repository.
Loading the toon Lunarwolf from US/Thorium Brotherhood from b.net then going to File>Save to Rawr4 Repository... gives me the following error:
 
I have performed the Suggested Fix and continue to receive this error. If I am posting this message without having performed the Suggested Fix I am aware that I am consuming the Developer(s) time in managing my Issue unnecessarily.
 
== Version: 4.1.3.0 ==
 
== Error Message ==
[net_uri_BadHostName]
Arguments: 
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=4.0.60129.0&File=System.dll&Key=net_uri_BadHostName
 
== StackTrace ==
   at System.Uri.CreateThis(String uri, Boolean dontEscape, UriKind uriKind)
   at System.Uri..ctor(String uriString)
   at Rawr.Rawr4RepoService.SetCharacterAsync(String identifier, String pw, String charXmlData)
   at Rawr.UI.Rawr4RepoSaveDialog.OKButton_Click(Object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Button.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(MouseButtonEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Control.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(Control ctrl, EventArgs e)
   at MS.Internal.JoltHelper.FireEvent(IntPtr unmanagedObj, IntPtr unmanagedObjArgs, Int32 argsTypeIndex, Int32 actualArgsTypeIndex, String eventName)
 
 
 
The name Rawr was trying to save as was "US Thorium Brotherhood Lunarwolf Moonkin" - the quotes being mine.
I've tried this with another toon as well with the same results.
 
Also unable to load a toon from the repo that I had saved in a previous version of Rawr.
WorkItem.Summary: [LoadCharacter] Unable to save/load to/from Rawr4 Repository

Comments.Message: Fixed for next version. Until then you will have to save files locally instead.
